IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF SILICON VALLEY IS TO STRENGTHEN AND ENRICH THE JEWISH COMMUNITY LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. OUR EFFORTS SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL SERVICE AND CHARITABLE PROGRAMS THAT EXEMPLIFY THE JEWISH VALUES OF K'LAL YISRAEL (TAKING RESPONSIBILITY FOR ONE ANOTHER), TZEDAKAH (CHARITY AND RIGHTEOUSNESS), AND TIKKUN OLAM (REPAIRING THE WORLD).
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF SILICON VALLEY IS TO STRENGTHEN AND ENRICH THE JEWISH COMMUNITY LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. OUR EFFORTS SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL SERVICE AND CHARITABLE PROGRAMS THAT EXEMPLIFY THE JEWISH VALUES OF K'LAL YISRAEL (TAKING RESPONSIBILITY FOR ONE ANOTHER), TZEDAKAH (CHARITY AND RIGHTEOUSNESS), AND TIKKUN OLAM (REPAIRING THE WORLD).
IRS990.Desc: DESIGNATED GIVING TO FUND & SUPPORT AGENCIES AND PROGRAMS INCLUDING JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER, LOCAL DAY SCHOOLS & SYNAGOGUES

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: LEVY FAMILY CAMPUS - DEVELOP, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A COMMUNITY CAMPUS FOR THE PURPOSE OF HOUSING JEWISH AGENCIES AND SERVICES PROVIDED BY OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. OF THE TOTAL REVENUE OF $3,615,534, THE AMOUNT OF $2,118,358 IS GRANTED BACK TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS IN THE FORM OF FREE RENT. THESE GRANTS ARE REPORTED IN FORM 990 AS PART OF THE DESIGNATED GIVING REPORTED ON LINE 4A ABOVE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: JEWISH COMMUNITY NEWS - PUBLISH A COMMUNITY PERIODICAL HIGHLIGHTING LOCAL JEWISH COMMUNITY NEWS, EVENTS AND ACTIVITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PROVIDE A COMMUNITY CHAPLAIN, OUTREACH EVENTS, E-NEWSLETTER & WEB SERVICES, MEMBER OF JEWISH COMMUNITY RELATIONS COUNCIL, SILICON VALLEY HOLOCAUST SURVIVORS GROUP. ISRAEL TRIP AND SUMMER CAMP SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY USING SPECIFIC PROJECT CODES TO TRACK INCOME AND EXPENSES OF EACH GRANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONE BOARD MEMBER IS A COUSIN TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TAX RETURN IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. COPIES ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS A NON-PUBLIC WEBSITE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. DISCLOSURES ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITEE WHICH ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR FOLLOW-UP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO'S CONTRACT IS NEGOTIATED WITH THE PRESIDENT ALONG WITH 2 EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS. THE SALARY IS BASED ON COMPARABILITY OF JEWISH FEDERATION CEO'S WITH SIMILAR SIZE COMMUNITIES AND CAMPAIGN AMOUNTS THROUGH A CEO COMPENSATION SURVEY THAT JFNA PROVIDES EACH YEAR. IN ADDITION, SALARIES OF CEO'S IN LOCAL JEWISH AGENCIES ARE TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC UPON REQUEST THROUGH TELEPHONE OR EMAIL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANYBODY WHO NEEDS THIS INFORMATION CAN CONTACT THE JEWISH FEDERATION OFFICE THROUGH TELEPHONE OR EMAIL. CONTACT INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON THE INTERNET.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A 3 MEMBER AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR SELECTING AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR EACH YEAR. THE MAKE-UP OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE COMPLIES WITH CALIFORNIA LAW. THE CFO AND AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW THE AUDIT PLAN WITH THE AUDITOR. A DRAFT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND AUDIT FINDINGS ARE DISCUSSED BY THE AUDITOR WITH THE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO ISSUANCE OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT.
